business.headline: Adani Group gets clean chit from Sebi over Hindenburg claimsHindenburg Research had alleged that four Adani group companies lent Rs 6.2 billion ($87.4 million) in 2020, without properly disclosing it in financial statements.
Can you own a credit card without a bank account? Find outYou don't always need a savings account to apply for a credit card; new digital options are changing the rules. Have a look.

Are Fed rate cut and tariff relief setting up a market rally?A softer stance from the US Federal Reserve and the possibility of reduced reciprocal tariffs have lifted investor mood. The big question now: are these triggers enough to set off a sustained rally in Indian markets?

Sensex, Nifty extend rally on US-India trade talk optimismThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 318.97 points to finish at 83,012.68, while the NSE Nifty50 advanced 93.35 points to settle at 25,423.60. Broader markets, however, displayed mixed momentum, with several indices ending weaker as profit-booking set in.

US may scrap 25% penal duty on India, cut reciprocal tariffs to 10–15%: CEAChief Economic Adviser V. Anantha Nageswaran indicated that the US reciprocal tariff on Indian goods, currently at 25%, may be reduced to 10–15%.

Missed your ITR deadline? 3 filing options you can still useIf you missed the Income Tax Return (ITR) deadline, don't panic. Taxpayers still have ways to stay compliant and avoid penalties, with three key filing options available even after the due date.

Want to get a loan this festive season? Here's what you can doFrom new clothes and jewellery to family trips and home makeovers, festivals often come with added costs. A personal loan can help bridge the gap, here's a simple guide to getting one this festive season.

iValue Infosolutions IPO opens: Should you consider subscribing?iValue Infosolutions plans to Rs 560 crore through an offer-for-sale of 1.87 crore shares. The price band is set at Rs 284–299 per share, with a minimum investment of 50 shares.

ITR refund 2025: How long will it take to reach you?Millions of taxpayers who filed their returns by the September 16 deadline are now waiting for the next big step, i.e., getting their refunds. But how long does it actually take for the money to land in your bank account?

Why gold loans are no longer just a last resort for borrowersGold loans are shedding their emergency-only image, becoming a mainstream credit choice for urban, semi-urban, and rural India, driven by gold prices, regulation, digital access, and flexible borrowing solutions.

Should investors buy IT stocks right now? Here's what Ventura Securities saysVentura Securities warns of a shift, with US-driven risks mounting, domestic sectors like banking and NBFCs offer a safer path, leaving IT investors to weigh growth against growing uncertainty.

Sensex, Nifty rise on US Fed rate cut; Infosys, Wipro gainThe S&P BSE Sensex gained over 350 points to trade above the 83,000 mark, while the NSE Nifty50 crossed 25,400 in early trade. Broader market indices also saw gains, with volatility remaining stable.

entertainment.headline: BIFF Day 2: Huma's Bayaan, Park Chan-wook's thriller and candid conversationsDay 2 of BIFF 2025 blended star-studded appearances, film premieres, and inclusive community initiatives, reinforcing its status as Asia's premier cinema festival.
Rajnikanth's daughter Soundarya calls him Powerhouse Appa after Coolie successSoundaryaa Rajinikanth praised her father as 'Powerhouse Appa' as 'Coolie' trended in Amazon Prime's global top 10.

Actor Robo Shankar, 46, dies day after on-set collapse. Kamal Haasan pays tributeTamil actor Robo Shankar died at a private hospital in Chennai on September 18, a day after collapsing on set. Kamal Haasan shared a heartfelt tribute on X.

Luca Guadagnino backs his MeToo-themed After the Hunt amid anti-feminist criticismDirector Luca Guadagnino responded to anti-feminist criticism of his MeToo-themed film 'After the Hunt'. He urged viewers to appreciate the powerful female characters and enjoy the story without generic labels.

Mahavatar Narsimha OTT release: When and where to watch the animation blockbusterDirector Ashwin Kumar's animated film 'Mahavatar Narsimha' is all set for its OTT release. The mystical action-drama based on ancient texts was released in theatres on July 25, 2025.

Himani Shivpuri recalls when superstitious Govinda refused to board a flightActor Himani Shivpuri opened up about Govinda's shifting work habits and belief in mahurats. She added how such beliefs have led to delays and confusion on various film sets.

Vrusshabha teaser: Mohanlal transforms into a fierce warrior in this period dramaThe wait is finally over. After treating fans with the first-look poster, Mohanlal unveiled the teaser of his upcoming film, 'Vrusshabha.'  The film marks the veteran actor's third foray into the period action genre in recent years.

Varun Dhawan gets trolled for interrupting Janhvi Kapoor's AI remark: DisrespectfulAt the trailer launch of 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari', Janhvi Kapoor spoke about the misuse of AI-generated images, but Varun Dhawan interrupted her with a joke, sparking backlash online. Social media users criticised Varun for being "disrespectful" and diverting attention from a serious issue.

Urmila Matondkar's birthday wish for Shabana Azmi has nostalgic Masoom throwbackOn Shabana Azmi's birthday, actor Urmila Matondkar shared a heartfelt note and nostalgic photos from her debut film 'Masoom', recalling their decades-long bond. Urmila praised Azmi for inspiring her both on and off-screen, calling her "Queen" at 75.

Who is Jimmy Kimmel? TV host faces suspension after controversial remarks on Charlie KirkABC has stopped airing 'Jimmy Kimmel Live!' after the host made "offensive" remarks about the death of conservative leader Charlie Kirk. The show has been taken off-air indefinitely, ending Kimmel's long late-night run for the time being.

The Ba***ds of Bollywood review: It's Aryan's love letter to the filmy chaos, dramaRelease Date:Thu Sep 18, 2025Aryan Khan's directorial debut, 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' premiered on September 18. The show isn't about exposing Bollywood, it's about embracing its madness. With wit, cameos, and chaos, the Netflix show is messy, filmy, and oh-so-fun.

Huma Qureshi wins Face of Asia Award in Busan, dedicates it to women dreamersActor Huma Qureshi was presented the Face of Asia Award at the Busan International Film Festival (BIFF). She dedicated her win to young girls who dared to dream.

Bollywood's big deja vu: Same stories, new faces, zero shameBollywood keeps serving recycled plots driven by glamour and hype. Here's exploring why stories are missing in today's big-budget films and what audiences really want.

Ed Sheeran confirms collaboration with Karan Aujla, song to be out in OctoberBritish singer Ed Sheeran confirmed his collaboration with Punjabi singer Karan Aujla. He shared that the song, which was shot in New York, will be out in October.

Team Jeremiah vs Team Conrad: Who really won in The Summer I Turned Pretty?A deep dive into 'The Summer I Turned Pretty's ultimate love triangle. Team Jeremiah vs Team Conrad - who really won, who should have, and why fans are still fighting about it.

Amaal Mallik alleges Anu Malik betrayed his father, recalls mother being mistreatedSinger-composer Amaal Mallik shared the struggles and hardships his parents underwent on 'Bigg Boss 19'. He blamed his uncle Anu Malik for betraying his father and also recalled how his mother was taunted by Daboo Malik's family.

Prakash Raj, Arjun Das's first posters raise hype for Pawan Kalyan's OGAhead of the much-anticipated gangster action drama 'OG', the makers released the first posters of Arjun Das and Prakash Raj. Starring Pawan Kalyan and Priyanka Arul Mohan, the trailer launch is set for September 21.

Actor Priyanka Mohan calls OG a blessing, praises Pawan Kalyan as true leaderActor Priyanka Mohan opened up about her experience working with Pawan Kalyan in 'They Call Him OG', calling him a true leader both on and off the screen. She described the project as a blessing.

First Spirit then Kalki 2: Deepika Padukone's abrupt exit and the controversiesOn September 18, the makers of 'Kalki 2898 AD' announced that Deepika Padukone will not be part of the sequel. Earlier this year, she made headlines for abruptly exiting Sandeep Reddy Vanga-Prabhas's 'Spirit'.

general news.headline: US revokes sanctions waiver for India, other countries at Iran's Chabahar portThe waiver had allowed India and other countries to continue work on the port without facing US penalties. The US has now revoked the sanction exemption, and it will come into effect from September 29.

ICC considers action against Pakistan for violation of rules in Asia Cup: ReportAsia Cup: The International Cricket Committee is considering action against Pakistan for violation of multiple rules, including filming of restricted areas, before their match against the UAE on Wednesday. Pakistan released a video of their team's discussion with match referee Andy Pycroft, claiming he apologised for miscommunication during the handshake snub on Sunday.

I am very close to India and Modi: Trump after repeated rant over Russia oil tradeUS President Donald Trump, while addressing reporters during his UK visit, said that he is very close to India and Prime Minister Narendra Modi. His remarks come after his repeated rants over India's Russian oil trade.

Only 24 pleas in Aland were genuine: Poll panel rebuts Rahul Gandhi's chargeThe Karnataka poll panel said that they had received over 6,000 pleas in 2022 over electors' name deletion. Upon further probe, the poll panel found that only 24 complaints were genuine.

The Ba***ds of Bollywood review: It's Aryan's love letter to the filmy chaos, dramaRelease Date:Thu Sep 18, 2025Aryan Khan's directorial debut, 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' premiered on September 18. The show isn't about exposing Bollywood, it's about embracing its madness. With wit, cameos, and chaos, the Netflix show is messy, filmy, and oh-so-fun.

Actor Robo Shankar, 46, dies day after on-set collapse. Kamal Haasan pays tributeTamil actor Robo Shankar died at a private hospital in Chennai on September 18, a day after collapsing on set. Kamal Haasan shared a heartfelt tribute on X.

Neeraj Chopra fails to win medal after 7 years, young Sachin announces arrivalWorld Athletics Championships 2025: Neeraj Chopra's winning streak that lasted 7 years came to an end as his title defence in Tokyo ended in disappointment. However, 25-year-old Sachin Yadav announced his arrival on the big stage with a fourth-place finish on Thursday, September 18.

Highlights: Attempt to malign Election Commission, question credibility, says ex-poll body chiefRahul Gandhi vote chori press meeting Highlights: Congress MP and Lok Sabha LoP Rahul Gandhi steps up attack on the Election Commission, alleging large-scale voter deletions through software-driven fraud; presents 'evidence' from Karnataka to back claims. Rahul Gandhi said he would soon come out with a "hydrogen bomb" of revelations about "vote chori".

What went wrong for Neeraj Chopra in World Championships finalWorld Athletics Championships 2025: Neeraj Chopra admitted he was not in peak physical condition ahead of his title defence, revealing that he suffered a back injury while training in the Czech Republic earlier this month.
The 80% gap: Why most Indians are underinsured and why it's time to actThe solution lies in choosing a comprehensive life cover that reflects modern realities.

University of Bath School of Management: Where Careers Begin With ConfidenceWith students from over 160 countries and a strong alumni network spanning 130 nations, the School creates a community that feels global in reach yet personal in experience.

US may scrap 25% penal duty on India, cut reciprocal tariffs to 10–15%: CEAChief Economic Adviser V. Anantha Nageswaran indicated that the US reciprocal tariff on Indian goods, currently at 25%, may be reduced to 10–15%.

How Trump tariffs are choking Little Indias across the USTariffs imposed by the Trump administration have hit Indian-American small businesses hard, especially in sectors like food, fashion, and retail. Across the US, especially in Little India, business owners report rising prices, falling demand, and fears of closure.

Asia Cup: Sri Lanka knock Afghanistan out, take Bangladesh into Super 4Sri Lanka chased down a 170-run target to knock Afghanistan out and seal their place in the Asia Cup Super 4. Mohammed Nabi's late counter-attack proved in vain as Afghanistan's bowlers were unable to contain the Sri Lankan chase.

Why AI171 crash families have sued fuel switch maker Honeywell, Boeing?The families of four passengers who were killed in the Air India plane crash in Ahmedabad have sued Boeing and Honeywell in a US court over "faulty fuel switches". The case has again brought attention to aircraft design and safety protocols, even as an official investigation into one of India's deadliest air disasters is on.

Do some dadagiri at home, shop freely: Amit Shah's GST 2.0 pitch to womenShah urged women to shop freely from Sept 22, when sweeping tax rate cuts for a wide range of common-use items take effect. The appeal came with a caveat: to only buy products made in India.

Bollywood's big deja vu: Same stories, new faces, zero shameBollywood keeps serving recycled plots driven by glamour and hype. Here's exploring why stories are missing in today's big-budget films and what audiences really want.

Putin let me down, he is killing many people: Trump month after grand Alaska meetSince the Alaska summit between Trump and Putin, hostilities between Russia and Ukraine have continued without any drop in intensity and the gravity of military exchanges between the two countries.

Helicopter only after you resign: What Nepal Army chief told Oli amid Gen Z protestsAs violent Gen Z-led protests engulfed Nepal, including the capital Kathmandu, then PM KP Sharma Oli's plea for a helicopter for a safe exit was met with army chief Ashok Raj Sigdel's condition. He asked Oli to resign first, says a report. This sealed the fate of the Oli regime, which faced heat over corruption and authoritarianism.

Adani Group gets clean chit from Sebi over Hindenburg claimsHindenburg Research had alleged that four Adani group companies lent Rs 6.2 billion ($87.4 million) in 2020, without properly disclosing it in financial statements.

Handshake row: Can sports be delinked from politics? Democratic Newsroom debatesIn this episode of Democratic Newsroom, the focus is on the India-Pakistan handshake row and the drama that unfolded ahead of the Pakistan-UAE on Wednesday in the ongoing Asia Cup.

How Pakistan uses just two cards to tap the Islamic ummahPakistan, the only Muslim nuclear-powered country, pitched for an Islamic NATO. It has signed a defence pact with Saudi Arabia, legitimising its nuclear weapons for Riyadh's use if attacked. Pakistan has used just two cards—nuclear and Islamic—to tap the ummah, with the ulterior motive of seeking aid.

Will Saudi involve itself if India, Pak go to war again? What the deal meansSaudi Arabia has signed a defence pact with nuclear-armed Pakistan, vowing that any attack on either nation will be considered an attack on both. Analysts have called the pact nothing but posturing. What does it mean for India?

Baloch commander behind Jaffer Express hijacking killed in Afghanistan?Rahman Gul Baloch, the masked Baloch Liberation Army (BLA) commander believed to have masterminded the Jaffer Express hijacking, was reportedly killed in Afghanistan. There's no official confirmation yet. It was Rahman Gul Baloch, alias Ustad Mureed, a former Pakistan Army officer, who transformed the BLA's Majeed Brigade from a rudimentary force into a sophisticated one.

sports.headline: Asia Cup: Sri Lanka knock Afghanistan out, take Bangladesh into Super 4Sri Lanka chased down a 170-run target to knock Afghanistan out and seal their place in the Asia Cup Super 4. Mohammed Nabi's late counter-attack proved in vain as Afghanistan's bowlers were unable to contain the Sri Lankan chase.

Watch: Mohammad Nabi smashes 5 consecutive sixes against Wellalage in Asia CupMohammad Nabi unleashed a stunning display by hitting five consecutive sixes against Sri Lanka in the Asia Cup 2025. He brought up his half-century off just 20 balls, the joint fastest by an Afghanistan batter.

Asia Cup: Kuldeep Yadav reveals his success mantra against PakistanIndia spinner Kuldeep Yadav remains unfazed by the noise surrounding the controversy ahead of the high-voltage Asia Cup Super 4 clash against Pakistan. The left-arm wrist-spinner also outlined his success mantra, saying he treats every batter the same, regardless of the opposition.

ICC considers action against Pakistan for violation of rules in Asia Cup: ReportAsia Cup: The International Cricket Committee is considering action against Pakistan for violation of multiple rules, including filming of restricted areas, before their match against the UAE on Wednesday. Pakistan released a video of their team's discussion with match referee Andy Pycroft, claiming he apologised for miscommunication during the handshake snub on Sunday.

In rainy Tokyo, Sydney McLaughlin runs fastest time in 40 years to win 400 mWorld Athletics Championships: Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone, who broke the world record to win Olympic gold over the hurdles last year, made the switch to the flat this season, came up with a sensational race on a rain evening in Tokyo to win the gold in women's 400m.

Benfica confirm Jose Mourinho's return as manager after more than two decadesPortuguese club Benfica have appointed Jose Mourinho as their manager for the second time, club president Rui Costa confirmed on Thursday. The former Chelsea, Real Madrid, Manchester United, and Inter Milan head coach, who parted ways with Turkey's Fenerbahce in August, began his managerial career at Benfica.

How Gambhir's clear communication helped Kuldeep during snub in England tourKuldeep Yadav revealed how head coach Gautam Gambhir communicated clearly during the England tour, where he didn't make the playing XI. Kuldeep revealed that he worked on his bowling and fitness during his time on the bench.

What went wrong for Neeraj Chopra in World Championships finalWorld Athletics Championships 2025: Neeraj Chopra admitted he was not in peak physical condition ahead of his title defence, revealing that he suffered a back injury while training in the Czech Republic earlier this month.

Indian javelin in safe hands: Neeraj Chopra praises Sachin's stellar Tokyo outingTwo-time Olympic medallist Neeraj Chopra said he was thrilled for Sachin Yadav, who narrowly missed out on a medal, finishing fourth in the javelin final at the World Athletics Championships. Chopra had hoped India would secure a podium finish through the 25-year-old, but Sachin fell short by just 40 centimetres.

Month after IPL retirement, R Ashwin set to represent India in Hong Kong SixesRavichandran Ashwin is set to pull on the India jersey once more, having been named in India's squad for the Hong Kong Sixes 2025, to be held from 7 to 9 November.

How Gambhir's clear communication helped Kuldeep during snub in England tourKuldeep Yadav revealed how head coach Gautam Gambhir communicated clearly during the England tour, where he didn't make the playing XI. Kuldeep revealed that he worked on his bowling and fitness during his time on the bench.

What went wrong for Neeraj Chopra in World Championships finalWorld Athletics Championships 2025: Neeraj Chopra admitted he was not in peak physical condition ahead of his title defence, revealing that he suffered a back injury while training in the Czech Republic earlier this month.

Indian javelin in safe hands: Neeraj Chopra praises Sachin's stellar Tokyo outingTwo-time Olympic medallist Neeraj Chopra said he was thrilled for Sachin Yadav, who narrowly missed out on a medal, finishing fourth in the javelin final at the World Athletics Championships. Chopra had hoped India would secure a podium finish through the 25-year-old, but Sachin fell short by just 40 centimetres.

Month after IPL retirement, R Ashwin set to represent India in Hong Kong SixesRavichandran Ashwin is set to pull on the India jersey once more, having been named in India's squad for the Hong Kong Sixes 2025, to be held from 7 to 9 November.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
